page.title: 03Broughton Waterworks.
page.content: The {Waterworks} was established in 1964. It employs 15 workers who live on the site with their families.The water is obtained from a series of boreholes which are scattered around the local area.Once the water is obtained it is softened because it is very hard.The water works cover an area of 3 acres. A viaduct behind the water works goes over a railway line. The railway line is the {main line} which connects the South of England with the North along the western side of the Pennines.The line is very busy with freight and passenger traffic passing every few minutes. Mrs Brown is the wife of one of the water workers.She says that the area is noisy around the water works due to the heavy wagons passing carrying limestone.A new {gravel quarry} is opening soon nearby.
